topic.title: When my site get +1 peer and how long he/she will be peer?
topic.body: When my site get one peer? When someone visit my webpage it automatically become peer for as long as he is on the page or as long as he has ZeroNet app turned on / untill he delete my webpage from his ZeroHello page sidebar?

topic.title: ZeroNet distribution and no single point of failure - explanation?
topic.body: Hello, please anyone can explain how my computer knows which IP it needs to connect in order to establish connection to zeronet while ZeroNet is claimed to be "No single point of failure" (at https://zeronet.io/)? So there is no node that is essental t connect to zero net? How it works then?

1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS.body:
Thx @nofish for helpfull expanation.
When my page has:
 Peers
    Connected:    2
    Connectable:    21
    Onion:    5
    Total:    21

It means that there is 21 people who has at east part of my site (not just page) saved on their computer and if they become online on ZeroNet and "Connected: 0", there is possibity they will seed the site even they are not on my site currently?

1_13EDCw412fCWqTmR4RxRw99aEd2ucYzDyM.body:
Why should this be needed? Stream it from within torrent client like qbittorrent. It support streaming of the torrent video: http://internetlifeforum.com/computers-technology/4772-how-play-movie-via-torrent-instantly-without-pre-downloading/
Not sure how do you imagine such site concept and how webtorrent would help in that case. Most of the time there wont be more than 1 video viewer, so i assume such site would need to cover all data transfer (videos) cost of all its visitors. PS: im noob
PS2: Here is example html page where is streamed one video file via webtorrent: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Kt7xxVRcxHcK14Mt7YZdXfh8MzUJMkvpk/webtorrentstream.html
